Benjamin Gutzmann

Hydrologist - Data Scientist - Programmer

History

This journey began somewhere in northern Germany where I was born and raised until I left for an unpredictable future. 2013 was the year when I started studying Hydrology, first because I felt I just had to do something, later because I got to know it more and more and started liking it a lot. I learned about our environment, the water crisis ("In Germany we will never have water scarcity."), and tools that allowed me to analysis the factors of those changes we are currently discovering.

It wasn't until 2016 when I started programming. We had to choose our project study and at first glance I didn't feel too comfortable with any of the given topics. However I still took a topic called "Analysis of homogeneity of precipitation time series in eastern Saxony, Germany". And to be honest it wasn't an easy start of for me back when I didn't even know what an array was. However I grew over myself and even continued writing my Bachelors thesis about the same topic. And what should I say? Nailed it and started working as student assistant at the Institute of Meteorology. Now this was my personal turning point: I'd always try to replace nasty Excel sheets by some small script written in R, the language of choice for most scientists at universities and my secret choice back then. I also started working at another company where I'd take more responsibility for my own kind of project, so the amount I was learning was quite a bit. That's it? Happy Ending?

NO.
